headline.main: Stating the Obvious: Hunger Is a Disease

docs.lead_paragraph: Hunger is a disease; starvation is its extreme form. Hunger can lead to starvation; starvation to death. Obvious, no?

headline.main: Fat Stigma Is Fast Becoming a Global Epidemic

byline.original: By TARA PARKER-POPE; Elisabeth Malkin contributed reporting from Mexico City

docs.abstract: Experts warn that as they step-up efforts to combat global threat of obesity, counter-trend is emerging of strong negative opinion toward overweight people; photo (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: In Mexico, the latest anti-obesity public health campaign shows people with bulging stomachs eating greasy food. ''I have always thought that it's your own fault,'' said Sergio Miranda, 35, who has a shoeshine stand in Mexico City. ''People eat just things that make them fat, like bread and pizza.''

headline.main: Fat Stigma Spreads Around the Globe

docs.abstract: As global health officials step up efforts to treat obesity as a worrisome public health threat, some researchers warn of a troubling side effect on perceptions about weight and body image.
docs.lead_paragraph: In Mexico, the latest anti-obesity public health campaign shows people with bulging stomachs eating greasy food.
docs.snippet: As global health officials step up efforts to treat obesity as a worrisome public health threat, some researchers warn of a troubling side effect on perceptions about weight and body image.

headline.main: A Mother's Life Is Taken, as She Feared

docs.abstract: Before she gave birth prematurely last May, Patricia Garcia worried that because of her obesity and related health conditions, she would die before her baby was grown; her prediction came true Sunday.Her prediction came true Sunday,
docs.lead_paragraph: About a year ago, Patricia Garcia, 5 feet tall and 261 pounds, had allowed herself to become the lead character in an article in The New York Times about the rise in maternal obesity, and how it was putting the health of mothers and babies in jeopardy and forcing hospitals to adapt.

headline.seo: Gastric Band Surgery Results Disappoint Researchers
headline.print_headline: PROGNOSIS: Troubles After Gastric Band Surgery
headline.main: Prognosis: Study Finds Troubles With Gastric Band Surgery

docs.lead_paragraph: More than a decade after having the procedure, patients had lost just 43 percent of their excess weight, a study finds.
docs.snippet: More than a decade after having the procedure, patients had lost just 43 percent of their excess weight, a study finds.
